description: The Supreme Court established a bench to address misconduct displayed by Punjab and Haryana High Court Judge Rajbir Sherawat. Justice Sherawat questioned the SC's authority, critiqued its influence over High Courts, and expressed doubts about the stay on his contempt proceedings. This intervention follows Sherawat's controversial July 17 order challenging SC's directives.
title: SC bristles, mulls action as Punjab & Haryana HC judge slams apex court

description: Suvendu Adhikari met home minister Amit Shah to discuss attacks on Hindus and temples in Bangladesh, emphasizing the necessity of CAA. Adhikari mentioned historical and ongoing persecution of Hindus in Bangladesh, referencing his family's migration during the 1971 war. Shah assured that the Centre is taking appropriate action and highlighted opposition parties' acknowledgment of CAA's need.
title: Bengal LoP Suvendu Adhikari calls on Amit Shah over attacks on Hindus in Bangladesh

description: Velayudhan PT, a long-serving postman, visited the now-lost village of Mundakkai in Wayanad after a devastating tragedy only to find no trace of the dwellings and post office where he had worked for over three decades. His family narrowly escaped the disaster that obliterated his home and the village he had grown to call his own.
title: Mundakkai’s postman returns, but without any letter to deliver

description: Velayudhan PT, a long-serving postman, visited the now-lost village of Mundakkai in Wayanad after a devastating tragedy only to find no trace of the dwellings and post office where he had worked for over three decades. His family narrowly escaped the disaster that obliterated his home and the village he had grown to call his own.
title: Mundakkai’s postman returns, but without any letter to deliver

description: Pune police were directed by the Juvenile Justice Board to respond to a plea for the release of a Porsche Taycan involved in a crash that injured two techies, driven by a minor. The minor's release from observation home has been ordered, while his parents face charges. The police oppose releasing the car as the investigation continues.
title: JJB seeks cops’ response on Porsche release

description: Pune police were directed by the Juvenile Justice Board to respond to a plea for the release of a Porsche Taycan involved in a crash that injured two techies, driven by a minor. The minor's release from observation home has been ordered, while his parents face charges. The police oppose releasing the car as the investigation continues.
title: JJB seeks cops’ response on Porsche release

description: Krishna Chivukula, an IIT-Madras alumnus and founder of Indo MIM Technology, donated Rs 228 crore to the institute. The funds will support fellowships for top BTech students, sportspersons, foreign students, and faculty conducting high-risk research. An academic block was named after him. This donation is one of the largest ever made to IIT-Madras.
title: Alumnus, a 1970 batch MTech, gifts IIT-M Rs 228 crore

description: A Pithoragarh court sentenced Sunita Devi to life imprisonment for the murder of her husband, Jitendra Ram, two years ago. The case was confirmed by the couple’s daughter, who testified against her mother. The court also imposed a fine of Rs 50,000, with an additional five-year term if unpaid.
title: Life imprisonment for woman after daughter tells cops, court about father’s brutal murder

description: A Pithoragarh court sentenced Sunita Devi to life imprisonment for the murder of her husband, Jitendra Ram, two years ago. The case was confirmed by the couple’s daughter, who testified against her mother. The court also imposed a fine of Rs 50,000, with an additional five-year term if unpaid.
title: Life imprisonment for woman after daughter tells cops, court about father’s brutal murder

description: The Supreme Court of India assigned the management of the Gokarna Mahabaleshwara temple in Karnataka to former judge B N Srikrishna and the Karwar district judge. The decision came after inter-group rivalry led to a stalemate. The court granted Srikrishna veto power, while the Karnataka government can replace the committee's private members chosen by the previous government.
title: SC entrusts Gokarna temple admin to judges

description: India hosted the inaugural multi-nation Tarang Shakti air combat exercise at Sulur in Tamil Nadu. Featuring Rafale, Eurofighter Typhoon jets, and military aircraft from France, Germany, UK, and Spain, the exercise aims to enhance military interoperability and strategic partnerships. Phase-II will be held at Jodhpur after Phase-I ends on August 14.
title: India hosts its 1st-ever multination air drill

description: Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan stated that under the Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana, farmers have received Rs 1.6 lakh crore in insurance claims against Rs 32,440 crore in premiums since 2016-17. He emphasized the scheme's farmer-friendly and affordable nature, noting the introduction of a 12% penalty for delayed claim disbursal from the Kharif 2024 season.
title: Agri insurance claims worth 1.6 lakh crore cleared so far, says Shivraj Chouhan

description: India imported approximately 18.6 lakh tonnes of urea valued at $730 million from China in 2023-24, along with 22.6 lakh tonnes of phosphatic and potassic fertilisers. MoS Anupriya Patel informed Rajya Sabha that India relies on imports to bridge the gap between production and demand. Efforts are underway to attain self-sufficiency through the revival of several fertiliser units.
title: India imported Rs 6,127 crore worth of urea from China in 2023-24

description: The Union education minister Dharmendra Pradhan dismissed claims that the Preamble to the Constitution was removed from NCERT textbooks. He criticized Congress for spreading misinformation and urged critics to verify facts. NCERT clarified that the Preamble's removal from certain textbooks was untrue and emphasized new curriculum changes respecting the Constitution under National Education Policy.
title: Congress allegation of no Preamble in textbooks politics of lies: Pradhan

description: AISSC, representing Sufi shrines, supported the government's proposal to amend the Waqf Act, citing dargahs as victims of mismanagement and corruption. AISSC Chairman Syed Naseruddin Chishty emphasized the need for a separate dargah board under the law. They met officials and highlighted continuous legal battles faced by smaller dargahs, demanding wider consultations on the bill. They highlighted that smaller dargahs are often slapped with notices resulting in endless legal battles.
title: Sufi shrines body hails bid to amend Waqf Act

description: Opposition criticized the finance bill's tax proposals, claiming it burdens the poor and middle class while sparing the wealthy. Various MPs highlighted issues like unemployment, inflation, indirect taxes, and low FDI. Amar Singh challenged finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman to present a proposal aiding the common man and suggested exempting incomes up to Rs 5 lakh from tax to boost consumption.
title: Tax proposals target poor, spare rich: Opposition

description: Home minister Amit Shah dismissed TMC MP Sougata Roy's suggestion to implement the 'West Bengal Model' against left-wing extremism in other states. Shah believed no state would want to adopt it. LWE violence significantly decreased, from 465 police stations in 2010 to 89 in the first half of 2023, with notable reductions in deaths and violent incidents.
title: Amit Shah, TMC MP Sougata Roy spar over 'Didi model' to fight Reds

description: The Congress party denied BJP MP Nishikant Dubey's claim that Priyanka Gandhi Vadra attended a dinner hosted by the Ambani family in Mumbai. Dubey, however, reaffirmed his statement, stating that Vadra was present with her children. Congress leaders dismissed the claim, noting Vadra was not in India at the time.
title: Priyanka attended Ambani wedding, says BJP MP; Cong rubbishes it as ‘fake narrative’
ED attaches Rs 1 crore assets in UP cop test case
ED attaches Rs 1 crore assets in UP cop test case
ED hit 93% conviction rate in PMLA cases, govt tells House

description: Former Karnataka CM Basavraj Bommai, during a discussion on the Finance Bill, 2024, in LS, praised PM Modi's resilience and leadership. He remarked that India is progressing towards becoming a developed nation by 2047 under Modi's guidance. Bommai emphasized the need to tackle poverty, unemployment, and illiteracy scientifically.
title: Like ‘Neelkanth’, PM bears insults but helps all, says BJP MP Basavraj Bommai
Afspa in force only in select Northeast locations

description: Amid protests from Manipur's Kuki community, two Assam Rifles battalions were withdrawn from sensitive buffer zones in the region and moved to Nagaland. The CRPF battalions, replacing them, will undergo extensive training, and are recommended to be placed under Assam Rifles' command for cohesive operations in Manipur, amid concerns over potential violence resurgence.
title: 2 Assam Rifles battalions moved out of Manipur ignoring tribals’ protests

description: Amid protests from Manipur's Kuki community, two Assam Rifles battalions were withdrawn from sensitive buffer zones in the region and moved to Nagaland. The CRPF battalions, replacing them, will undergo extensive training, and are recommended to be placed under Assam Rifles' command for cohesive operations in Manipur, amid concerns over potential violence resurgence.
title: 2 Assam Rifles battalions moved out of Manipur ignoring tribals’ protests
Clearing patch of land in TN, 2 schoolgirls find 2 neolithic axes
Clearing patch of land in TN, 2 schoolgirls find 2 neolithic axes
Beer, not vaccines, in UP hospital fridge; probe ordered
Beer, not vaccines, in UP hospital fridge; probe ordered

description: Telangana HC has asked the state’s Congress government to report by August 27 on the time needed to establish a Backward Castes commission and conduct a survey. Following a Supreme Court directive from March 2021, this is to ensure that reserved seats for Backward Castes in local bodies do not exceed 50% of total reservations.
title: Give timeline to set up backward caste panel, survey: HC to Telangana

description: Telangana HC has asked the state’s Congress government to report by August 27 on the time needed to establish a Backward Castes commission and conduct a survey. Following a Supreme Court directive from March 2021, this is to ensure that reserved seats for Backward Castes in local bodies do not exceed 50% of total reservations.
title: Give timeline to set up backward caste panel, survey: HC to Telangana

description: A 17-year-old tribal girl in Maoist-affected Narayanpur district thwarted an attack on her father by eight armed men. She wrested an axe from an attacker and protected her father until neighbors intervened. Police are investigating the incident, which left the father hospitalized but stable. The family suspects Maoist involvement.
title: 17-year-old girl takes on 8 armed men, saves father’s life

description: A 17-year-old tribal girl in Maoist-affected Narayanpur district thwarted an attack on her father by eight armed men. She wrested an axe from an attacker and protected her father until neighbors intervened. Police are investigating the incident, which left the father hospitalized but stable. The family suspects Maoist involvement.
title: 17-year-old girl takes on 8 armed men, saves father’s life

description: The Supreme Court proposed to examine whether only Constitution courts should impose fixed-term life imprisonments in heinous crimes, traditionally under the purview of trial courts. This follows a case where a Chhattisgarh trial court issued a 20-year sentence, raising questions on the jurisdiction of life term sentencing and convict remission rights after 14 years of imprisonment.
title: Can trial courts order fixed-term life imprisonment? SC to decide

description: ​A 46-year-old Pakistani man, Asif Merchant, has been charged by the US Department of Justice for plotting to kill politicians, government officials on the US soil. Prosecutors in Brooklyn announced criminal charges against Asif Merchant, accusing him of travelling to New York for the purposes of trying to hire a hitman for the assassinations. The plot was disrupted before it could be carried out. The document did not name any potential target but CNN reported that former president Donald Trump and other current and former US government officials might be the targets of the plot.
title: Who is Asif Merchant? Pak man with Iran links charged in assassination plots in US

description: Deposed Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina may have to extend her stay in India, as the UK ruled out asylum for her. Hasina, who arrived with her sister, is exploring options like the US and Finland. India remains cautious about her prolonged stay due to potential diplomatic implications with Dhaka's opposition parties. Despite the setback caused by Sheikh Hasina’s exit, India has said it wants its missions in Bangladesh to function normally once law and order is restored.
title: UK asylum tricky, ex-Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina looks at other options

description: From being stretchered off in her debut at Rio 2016 to a disappointing performance in Tokyo in 2021, Vinesh Phogat has now come full circle by making history as the first Indian woman wrestler to reach the Olympic final.
title: Vinesh overcomes setbacks to create Olympic history

description: It was a dream chance for India to enter the final of the Olympics after 44 years but Germany played spoilsport to that. Skipper Harmanpreet Singh (7th) and Sukhjeet Singh (36th) scored for India, while Gonzalo Peillat (18th), Christopher Ruhr (27th) and Marco Miltkau (54th) were the scorers for Germany.
title: India's Olympic hockey final dream ends after 2-3 loss against Germany

description: Tears of joy streamed down coach Woller Akos’s face as Vinesh Phogat made history by becoming the first Indian woman wrestler to reach an Olympic final. Vinesh secured at least a silver medal with a commanding 5-0 victory over Cuba’s Yusneylis Guzman Lopez in the 50kg semifinal. Training under Akos since 2018, Vinesh refined her technique to overcome vulnerabilities in her game. This win was a deeply emotional moment for both Phogat and her coach, reflecting years of hard work and dedication.
title: Watch: Vinesh's coach in tears as she reaches Oly final

description: Vinesh Phogat (50kg) became first Indian woman wrestler to enter Olympic finals, beating Cuba's Yusneylis Guzman 5-0 in the semis. With the win, Vinesh has guaranteed herself at least a silver medal.
title: Vinesh becomes 1st Indian woman wrestler to reach Olympic final

description: At the Paris Olympics, the men's 100m final saw all finalists clock sub-10-second finishes, with the top six surpassing Usain Bolt's peak speed of 27.8 mph. Despite these impressive feats, none came close to breaking Bolt's iconic 9.58-second world record. This highlights that sprinting excellence isn't just about raw speed but also about maintaining consistent acceleration, stride efficiency, and race strategy. Lyles' gold medal win at 9.79 seconds underscores this complex balance.
title: How Lyles, Tebogo beat Bolt’s top speed, yet missed 9.58s WR
'Homes attacked, temples vandalised': Hindus targetted in B'desh after Hasina ouster

description: Amazon's Great Freedom Sale is offering significant discounts on 65-inch 4K TVs from top brands like Sony and LG. Shoppers can benefit from No Cost EMI, instant bank discounts, and additional savings on exchange offers. Features include 4K Ultra HD displays, Dolby Audio, and smart functionalities for a seamless entertainment experience. The sale also ensures perks like free delivery and extended warranties.
title: Amazon Great Freedom Festival sale live: 65-inch 4K TV at discount

description: Rekha Sharma concluded her tenure as the chairperson of the National Commission for Women (NCW) after nine years. Sharma began her role in 2018 and played a significant part in gender sensitisation among police. Her tenure included controversies, particularly around alleged non-action in Manipur and biased actions against non-BJP ruled states, which she denied.
title: 'Roller coaster ride': NCW chief Rekha Sharma steps down as tenure ends

description: In the Budget 2024 presented by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, the government had proposed eliminating indexation benefits for homeowners.
title: LTCG relief for property sale! Now, pick between 20% tax with indexation or 12.5% without indexation

description: Vinesh Phogat has already made history as the first Indian woman wrestler to reach the Olympic final. Now, she is just one win away from becoming the third individual Indian athlete to win a gold medal. She will face USA's Ann Sarah Hildebrandt in the final.
title: Paris Olympics Day 12: India's Full Schedule

description: India commenced its first-ever multi-nation air combat exercise 'Tarang Shakti' at Sulur, Tamil Nadu, featuring Rafale and Eurofighter Typhoon jets along with military aircraft from France, Germany, UK, and Spain. The exercise aims to bolster military interoperability and strategic partnerships globally. Phase-II will be conducted at Jodhpur with 67 fighters and military aircraft involved.
title: India kicks off mega multi-nation air combat exercise at Sulur

description: Kamala Harris announced Tim Walz as her running mate for the 2024 Presidential election, opting for a progressive platform. Walz, the Governor of Minnesota, is known for his strong left-liberal policies and recent viral remarks against Trump Republicans. Josh Shapiro, a centrist choice, was passed over due to his pro-Israel stance.
title: Kamala's progressive Walz to the left

description: Indian shuttler Lakshya Sen narrowly missed out on a bronze medal in the men’s singles event at the Paris 2024 Olympics, finishing fourth after a 21-13, 16-21, 11-21 loss to Malaysia's Zii Jia Lee. Despite a strong start, Sen couldn’t maintain his momentum and struggled against Jia's aggressive play in the final two sets. Reflecting on his journey, Sen expressed gratitude to his supporters and requested privacy to regroup, vowing to come back stronger and win future laurels for India.
title: 'I sincerely request space and privacy': Lakshya Sen

description: A federal judge ruled that Google abused its dominant position in the search and advertising markets, violating antitrust laws. This decision could benefit Microsoft, as its Bing search engine may replace Google as the default search provider for Apple. Google paid $18 billion to Apple in 2021 to maintain its position on Apple devices.
title: Google vs US government: How 'bad news' for Google may be ‘good news’ for Microsoft

description: Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus expressed his willingness to lead an interim government in Bangladesh following widespread protests that led to the departure of Sheikh Hasina. Yunus emphasized the need for free elections to achieve lasting peace. Acknowledging the youth's desire for change, he expressed his readiness to take action if needed. Student protest coordinators announced Yunus would be the chief adviser of the interim government, with further proposals expected soon.
title: 'Lasting peace will only come with ... ': B'desh interim govt adviser Yunus
Indian-American judge Amit Mehta rules Pichai-led Google is monopoly

description: Defending champion Neeraj Chopra declared that he is ready for the high-quality javelin throw Olympic finals after making quite a statement by qualifying top of the charts with a season's best performance in his very first attempt in Paris on Tuesday.
title: 'That's the real thing': Neeraj Chopra focuses on final

description: SummerSlam brought surprising developments as Finn Balor revealed the new lineup for Judgment Day, excluding Rhea Ripley and Damian Priest. This betrayal led fans to speculate that the two might team up with Jey Uso and Sami Zayn. The wrestling community anticipates this potential alliance to challenge their former faction members, Liv Morgan and Dominik Mysterio.
title: Fans predict fates of Rhea Ripley and Damian Priest following Judgment Day split
Terrorists trapped in J&K's Udhampur, encounter underway

description: Today's entertainment buzz is on fire! Kusha Kapila opens up about dealing with her divorce from Zorawar Singh Ahluwalia, while Anu Aggarwal defends Ranveer Singh's daring photoshoot. Ajay Devgn begins filming 'Son of Sardaar 2,' Kangana Ranaut visits flood-hit areas in Himachal Pradesh, and Sunny Leone addresses her past as an adult film star.
title: Kusha Kapila, Sunny Leone: Top 5 entertainment news of the day

description: Facing a wrestler who had never experienced defeat in her international career might seem daunting. Such a challenge would typically create immense pressure for any competitor. But it was not the case with star Indian wrestler Vinesh Phogat who brought an end to the winning-run of Japanese grappler Yui Susaki.
title: 'Unreal': Neeraj praises Vinesh's win over Yui Susaki
Who is Tim Walz, Kamala Harris' pick for vice president

description: Iran's Ambassador to India, Iraj Elahi, urged India to play an active role in resolving the West Asia crisis due to its strong ties with Israel and Palestine. He emphasized India's strategic importance and historical support for Palestine. The call came amid heightened violence involving Israel, Hamas, and Hezbollah, urging India to leverage its influence to promote peace.
title: India can use its 'influence to stop genocide' in Gaza: Iran envoy
Kamala Harris picks Tim Walz as running mate: US media reports
Isro set to launch advanced Earth observation satellite EOS-08 on SSLV

description: Indian wrestler Vinesh Phogat has made history by reaching the semifinals of the women’s 50kg freestyle wrestling at the Tokyo Olympics, marking her first Olympic semifinal appearance. She secured this spot with two impressive victories: a dramatic 3-2 win over reigning champion Yui Susaki and a 7-5 victory against former European champion Oksana Livach. Phogat’s resilience and tactical skill have drawn global attention, and with the next match against Cuba’s Yusneylis Guzman Lopez, she aims to win India’s first wrestling medal in Paris.
title: Internet reacts as Vinesh qualifies for Olympic semifinal

description: Google contested a court ruling that found it guilty of misusing its dominance in search and advertising. Google emphasized that the court acknowledged its search engine's superiority but opposed limitations on its availability. The verdict highlighted Google's monopoly status and the impact of default settings. Google plans to appeal the decision, maintaining its focus on quality user products.
title: Google vs the US government: Google calls out the ‘Big Irony’

description: Google contested a court ruling that found it guilty of misusing its dominance in search and advertising. Google emphasized that the court acknowledged its search engine's superiority but opposed limitations on its availability. The verdict highlighted Google's monopoly status and the impact of default settings. Google plans to appeal the decision, maintaining its focus on quality user products.
title: Google vs the US government: Google calls out the ‘Big Irony’
Why is Iran expected to attack Israel? What we know

description: South Asia has experienced significant political shifts over the last three years, with regime changes in Afghanistan, Pakistan, Sri Lanka, and Bangladesh. Notable events include the Taliban's rise to power in Afghanistan, Imran Khan's ouster in Pakistan, protests forcing Gotabaya Rajapaksa's resignation in Sri Lanka, and Sheikh Hasina fleeing Bangladesh amid violent unrest.
title: Afghanistan, Pak, Sri Lanka and now B'desh: What's going on in India's neighbourhood?

description: Seasoned Indian wrestler Vinesh Phogat entered her maiden Olympic semifinals in the 50kg category after notching up stunning victories over defending champion Yui Susaki of Japan and higher-ranked Ukrainian Oksana Livach along the way on Tuesday.
title: Vinesh Phogat enters maiden Olympic semi-final

description: Roman Reigns made a triumphant return at SummerSlam 2024, aiding Cody Rhodes against Solo Sikoa. Despite speculation of a face turn, Reigns remains in his villain arc, still embracing the Tribal Chief persona and showing indifference to public opinion. No official confirmation of his face turn has been made by WWE or Reigns yet.
title: 3 reasons why Roman Reigns is still in his villain arc despite helping Cody
'No provision for temporary ... ': UK authorities on ex-Bangladesh PM Hasina's asylum plan

description: Listed first among the line-up of 16 throwers in Group B of the qualification round at Stade de France on Tuesday, India's Neeraj Chopra, the reigning world and olympic champion, threw the spear a mammoth 89.34 meters away to end his first day in office in Paris early. The final is scheduled for Thursday.
title: Watch: Neeraj Chopra's monstrous throw to enter Oly final

description: NCERT revised its curriculum by removing the Preamble to the Indian Constitution from several Class 3 and Class 6 textbooks, including subjects like languages and environmental studies. NCERT officials clarified that they aim to instill constitutional values through Fundamental Duties, Rights, and the National Anthem, aligning with NEP-2020's goals for holistic child development.
title: Allegations of removing preamble from textbooks is baseless: NCERT

description: Bangladesh's uncompromising ex-prime minister Khaleda Zia has been released from years of house arrest after her bitter enemy Sheikh Hasina was ousted as premier and fled as protesters stormed her palace. She was later released into house arrest on condition she neither took part in politics nor went abroad for medical treatment.
title: Bangladesh ex-PM Khaleda Zia freed after arch-rival Sheikh Hasina toppled

description: The key would be to retrace our steps and align our long-term goals to identify not just incremental changes but also ways to explore bold and path-breaking alternatives that put Indian Railways on a smooth track and bring it up to speed.
title: Why it’s time to explore bold alternatives that put railways on smooth track
Right to work remains on track now for spouses of H-1B workers

description: The National Payments Corporation of India discussed partnerships with startups to introduce biometric authentication for UPI transactions. This would enable users to verify payments using fingerprints on Android devices and face ID on iPhones, replacing the current UPI PIN. The move followed the RBI's proposal for alternative authentication methods to enhance security and user experience.
title: NPCI may be planning to 'dump' OTPs, PINs for UPI transactions

description: The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) carried out an airstrike in Maifadoun, southern Lebanon, targeting a building linked to Hezbollah's Southern Front unit. The attack, guided by Shin Bet, resulted in the deaths of four Hezbollah members. Another structure in Khiam was also targeted under the operation. Hezbollah has not yet responded.
title: IDF targets Hezbollah buildings in Lebanon; four members killed

description: Indian wrestler Vinesh Phogat defeated Japan's Yui Susaki, the reigning gold-medallist and four-time world champion, in a dramatic comeback in the final five seconds to advance to the quarter-final of the 50kg category at the Olympic Games. Despite trailing 0-2, Phogat secured a takedown, earning three points to win 3-2.
title: Wrestler Vinesh Phogat stuns defending champion Yui to reach Olympics quarters

description: Dhana Dhanya Pushpa Bhara is a patriotic song by DL Ray that celebrates the natural beauty, cultural richness, and deep emotional connection to the poet's homeland. The song vividly describes the land's abundance, with its fertile fields, gentle rivers, and harmonious nature, portraying it as a utopia. The song became a rallying call for protesters seeking Sheikh Hasina's ouster.
title: How a Hindu poet's song became an anthem of hope in Bangladesh

description: Systematic investment plans (SIPs) in thematic/sectoral funds, and small and mid-cap schemes, outperformed the Nifty 50 index over the past three years. However, fund managers advise focusing on reasonable valuations and hybrid funds instead of solely past performers.
title: These mutual funds have returned 100% more than Nifty!
'At very short notice, Sheikh Hasina ... ': EAM Jaishankar on Bangladesh turmoil in RS

description: Bangladesh Air Force flight AJAX1431, suspected to be carrying Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, became the most tracked flight on Flightradar24 with over 29,000 users following it. Amidst political turmoil, Hasina resigned after 15 years in power and fled to India. She landed at Hindon airbase near Ghaziabad and is expected to stay there temporarily.
title: Bangladesh flight likely carrying former PM among the 'most-tracked' flights
'Minorities, temples attacked': What Jaishankar said on Indians in Bangladesh

description: Investor Jim Rogers has warned of a potential market collapse due to rising global debt and is holding substantial cash. He sees prolonged prosperity as a risk and prefers silver if forced to invest.
title: Jim Rogers warns! 'America & world long overdue for a problem'
Former dy PM LK Advani admitted to Delhi hospital, condition stable

description: President Droupadi Murmu received Fiji's highest civilian honor, the 'Companion of the Order,' recognizing the strong India-Fiji ties. She lauded Fiji's cultural diversity and announced new projects like a specialty hospital in Suva. She praised the Indian diaspora's contributions and highlighted initiatives to connect them with their roots. Her tour includes visits to New Zealand and Timor-Leste.
title: President Murmu receives Fiji's highest civilian award

description: Actress turned politician Kangana Ranaut recently visited a few flood-hit areas in her home state, Himachal Pradesh where rescue and relief measures were underway.
title: Kangana Ranaut visits flood affected areas in Himachal Pradesh

description: Farooq Abdullah commented on the crisis in Bangladesh, suggesting a lesson for dictators facing public wrath as Sheikh Hasina fled amid protests. He praised the opposition's victory over dictatorship and criticized India's handling of the dissent in Jammu and Kashmir. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar briefed leaders on the situation, emphasizing the government's contact with the Bangladesh Army.
title: Farooq Abdullah's cryptic lesson 'for every dictator' from Bangladesh crisis

description: Also competing alongside Neeraj will be Kishore Jena, who qualified for Paris with his silver medal at the Asian Games in Hangzhou last year, where Neeraj, who is also the reigning world champion, won his second consecutive Asiad gold. While Jena is slotted in Group A of qualification round, Neeraj will throw in Group B.
title: Explained: How javelin qualification works as Neeraj takes the field

description: The Indian High Commission in London issued a travel advisory urging citizens to exercise caution amid ongoing protests and violence in the UK. The unrest, fueled by misinformation surrounding the deaths of three young girls, has led to serious safety concerns. UK authorities are working to control the situation and restore order.
title: India issues travel advisory for citizens visiting UK amid protests

description: Amazon's Great Freedom Sale offered significant discounts on top smartphones under Rs 40,000 from brands like Xiaomi and OnePlus. Highlights included the Motorola Razr 40 and HONOR 200 5G, all equipped with advanced features like high-refresh-rate displays and powerful processors. Additional benefits included No Cost EMI, free delivery, and exchange deals.
title: Amazon Great Freedom Festival sale live: Smartphones under Rs 40,000

description: India experienced multiple close calls at the Paris Olympics, finishing just outside the medal positions in several events. Losses in archery, shooting, and badminton, among others, hindered India's ambition of achieving a double-digit medal tally. Notable near-misses included the archery mixed team bronze playoff, Arjun Babuta in men's 10m air rifle, and Lakshya Sen in badminton.
title: How India lost as many as five medals by a whisker in Paris

description: Yusuf Dikec, a Turkish shooter, has captured social media's attention with his casual appearance and minimal equipment at the Paris Olympics. He became a viral sensation and was even meme-shared by Elon Musk. Dikec's laid-back style led him to question Musk about the future of robots in sports, sparking further dialogue online.
title: Musk shared meme of Yusuf Dikec who had a 'Robot' question for him

description: In 2024, the tech sector faces unprecedented volatility, with over 8,000 job losses in July alone, bringing the year’s total to 124,517 layoffs globally. Economic pressures and rapid technological shifts drive major companies like Intel and Microsoft to cut staff. To navigate this turbulent landscape, professionals must upskill, showcase their value, and network strategically to enhance job security and prepare for future opportunities.
title: How to secure your position amidst massive tech layoffs in 2024
Bangladesh unrest top developments: President dissolves parliament

description: The Enforcement Directorate filed a supplementary chargesheet against former railway minister Lalu Prasad, his son Tejashwi Yadav, and others, alleging a land-for-job scam when Prasad was railway minister. The chargesheet names 11 accused and includes 96 documents. The prosecution seeks to prosecute for money laundering and confiscate previously attached assets, with the next hearing slated for August 13.
title: ED files supplementary chargesheet against Lalu, Tejashwi Yadav

description: The Directorate General of GST Intelligence (DGGI) is investigating Infosys for allegedly evading more than Rs 32,400 crore in GST payments between July 2017 and March 2022.
title: No relief for Infosys? Govt unlikely to relax $4 billion GST demand

description: External affairs minister Jaishankar expressed hope for 'unanimous support' after briefing an all-party meeting about the escalating situation in Bangladesh, caused by street protests over job quotas that led to Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's resignation and flight to India. The meeting included key leaders from various political parties and senior government officials.
title: All-party meet on Bangladesh: Rahul asks if foreign hand was involved

description: The production-spec Tata Curvv looks very similar to the concept version. It features a bold front end with an LED lightbar spanning across the width similar to what we’ve seen in the Nexon. It also gets a strong shoulder line with flared wheel arches which gives it a strong presence.
title: Tata Curvv EV launch: Price expectation, battery, range, features and more

description: Following the resignation of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, former cricket captain and MP Mashrafe Bin Mortaza's house was set on fire amidst massive unrest in Bangladesh. Other notable targets included Awami League offices and properties belonging to key party figures. The violence erupted due to widespread student protests, causing significant damage across multiple regions.
title: Former Bangladesh cricket captain Mortaza's house set ablaze

description: In July 2024, Supreme Court lawyer Mukul P Unny was scammed out of Rs 38,000 while exchanging his iPhone 13 for an iPhone 15 on Amazon. A delivery executive, supported by a supervisor, tricked Unny into returning the new phone. Despite initially reassuring him, Amazon's investigation concluded without issuing a refund. Later, Amazon did refund the amount after persistent follow-ups.
title: iPhone 15 exchange scam on Amazon: Lawyer shares how he was 'duped'
'Risk ending up like Pak': Hasina's son after political turmoil in Bangladesh

description: Vinod Kambli, a former dashing left-hander, made a significant impact in the 1990s with his explosive batting. He gained fame for his impressive performances in domestic cricket and international matches. He was known for his flamboyant style and played a crucial role in India's historic Test series win against England in 1993, scoring two centuries in a single match at Old Trafford.
title: 'Unwell' Vinod Kambli struggling to walk properly

description: A 50-year-old American woman found chained to a tree in Sindhudurg, Maharashtra, claimed she shackled herself due to mental health issues. The police, alerted by a shepherd, rescued her and took her to a hospital. The woman's statement indicated she had brought the chains and keys herself.
title: Chained myself to tree: US woman found in Maharashtra forest tells cops

description: Four cases of amoebic meningoencephalitis, including one death, were reported in Thiruvananthapuram. Those infected had bathed in Kavinkulam pond, now off-limits as per health department directives. Samples confirmed the presence of the infection, and public alerts were issued. The deceased, Akhil, had sought treatment for fever, raising awareness on avoiding contaminated water sources.
title: 4 amoebic brain infection cases reported in Thiruvananthapuram, one dead
Kamala Harris formally becomes Democratic presidential nominee

description: A 12-year-old gangrape survivor from Ayodhya has been admitted to Queen Mary's hospital in Lucknow due to inadequate medical facilities in Ayodhya. She is under observation by expert doctors. The Samajwadi Party has demanded the accused be hanged and compensation for the survivor, highlighting their concerns about potential government retaliation.
title: Ayodhya gangrape survivor admitted in hospital, MP says 'hang culprit'
'Hasina threw me out of Bangladesh to please Islamists, who forced her out today'
5 Haryana men in tiff with UP eatery owner over ‘mixed’ biryani stall

description: A place in the final, confirmation of a medal -- the stakes are pretty high, even higher for India, who haven't played an Olympic hockey final for 44 years and have not won successive hockey medals at the Games for 52 years. And PR Sreejesh will hope that he finishes his career with a medal in the biggest game of his iconic career, an Olympic final. For each of the above to happen, India will have to beat Germany.
title: This Indian hockey team won't need Dr Kalra's 'sesame pills'

description: The Ahmedabad unit of DGGI issued a show cause notice to Binance, demanding Rs 722 crore under GST. This move aimed at regulating virtual currency market. Binance allegedly collected fees from Indian customers and did not register under the Indian GST framework. Binance previously faced a Rs 18 crore penalty for AML non-compliance.
title: DGCI sends Rs 722 crore GST notice to Binance

description: The Ahmedabad unit of DGGI issued a show cause notice to Binance, demanding Rs 722 crore under GST. This move aimed at regulating virtual currency market. Binance allegedly collected fees from Indian customers and did not register under the Indian GST framework. Binance previously faced a Rs 18 crore penalty for AML non-compliance.
title: DGGI sends Rs 722 crore GST notice to Binance
Gujarat gambling buddies turn bus into casino

description: 26-year-old Neeraj Chopra has won numerous titles, including Asian Games and Commonwealth Games gold, and is the defending Olympic and world champion. However, his journey has been challenging due to an adductor muscle issue early this year. His coach confirmed that the niggle is now gone, and he is currently having full throwing sessions.
title: Neeraj Chopra ready to begin his quest for another gold
West Bengal assembly sees rare show of TMC-BJP unity
Akal Takht releases Sukhbir Badal’s 3-page letter seeking forgiveness

description: Salman Khan, Bollywood’s iconic 'Dabangg,' boasts a staggering net worth of Rs 2900 crores. Renowned for his acting prowess and business acumen, Khan's assets include lavish properties, a private yacht, and a fleet of luxury vehicles. His expansive wealth is also fueled by successful ventures in film production, charitable work, and strategic investments.
title: Salman Khan: ‘Dabangg’ with a staggering net worth of Rs 2900 crores

description: A past video of Kamala Harris calling on Americans to 'stay woke' during a 2017 Recode conference has resurfaced on social media. Critics, including conservative author James Lindsay, have since targeted Harris as a 'Communist functionary.' The video prompted severe public reactions, highlighting issues discussed during the conference like immigration and drug policies.
title: Should Americans be woke? Kamala says yes in an old video

description: Three uniformed personnel, Jithil Jayan of NDRF, his brother Army JCO Jinosh Jayan, and cousin Havildar Praveen Prakash, faced personal loss while assisting in landslide recovery efforts in Wayanad's Chooralmala. The disaster claimed their cousin Jagadeesh, his wife Saritha, and their son Sharan. Only Saritha's body remains missing. The team continues their search for survivors.
title: Army bros conduct rescue ops in their own village
How India shielded Sheikh Hasina’s flight from potential threats

description: Coordinators of the recent student protests in Bangladesh proposed forming a new interim government with Nobel Peace laureate Muhammad Yunus as chief advisor. The announcement was made in a video on Facebook. The Bangladesh army chief scheduled a meeting with protest leaders at 12 pm local time the same day.
title: Who is Muhammad Yunus, chief adviser of interim B'desh govt
14 deaths in a month at Asha Kiran shelter home strange, says HC

description: The Amazon Great Freedom Festival sale saw a surge in OTP scams. Amazon warned customers about fraudsters posing as representatives to steal personal details. The company advised against sharing OTPs over the phone. Shoppers can report suspicious communication to Amazon and register cybercrime complaints via the National Cyber Crime Reporting Portal or call 1930.
title: Amazon Freedom sale: ‘OTP scam warning' from the company

description: One of the accused in the Salman Khan house firing case has admitted that he was influenced by Lawrence Bishnoi's philosophy but the gangster has played no part in the gun firing. This accused Vicky Gupta further added that he didn't have any intention of harming the actor!
title: Accused in Salman Khan house firing case: No intention to harm him
Rolex to Tesla: Did Adin Ross just put Trump in hot water with these expensive gifts?

description: The 26-year-old Lovlina ’s defeat concluded India’s boxing efforts at the Olympics, following Nishant Dev’s earlier elimination from the men’s 71kg quarterfinals in a closely contested match. The six-member boxing team, comprising four women and two men, represented India at the Games, with four members exiting in the preliminary rounds.
title: 'I really want to say sorry': Lovlina Borgohain

description: Two days earlier, two individuals from the same organisation were arrested and jailed for allegedly performing a similar ritual at the Unesco World Heritage Site.
title: Woman held for hoisting saffron flag at Taj Mahal

description: For nearly two decades, Basheer Kalathiparambil, 44, has been a constant presence in Kerala's major tragedies. An electrician by profession, Basheer has handled hundreds of bodies in disasters like cyclone Ockhi, the Kavalappara landslide, and the recent Wayanad landslide. His volunteer work involves marking and cleaning bodies, selflessly aiding authorities and grieving families.
title: Kerala’s ‘helping hand’ for 18 years says Wayanad worst he’s seen

description: Neeraj, the current Olympic and world champion, will be the center of attention as he aims to defend his gold medal. His best throw of the season, 88.36m, was achieved prior to the competition in Paris. The 26-year-old athlete will be determined to deliver a performance that secures his position at the top of the podium once again. Kishore Jena extended his well-wishes to his fellow countryman as he prepares to defend his title.
title: Neeraj Chopra and his rivalry with Pakistan's Nadeem
Resolution against Bengal's division unites assembly
Google illegally maintains monopoly over internet search, US judge rules
